info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:14PM CDT until June 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN WHITE...SOUTHEASTERN WAYNE...SOUTHWESTERN WABASH... SOUTHERN EDWARDS...NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON AND WEST CENTRAL POSEY COUNTIES... At 314 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Fairfield, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Carmi, Fairfield, Albion, Grayville, Crossville, Jeffersonville, Mill Shoals, Browns, Springerton, Golden Gate, Belle Prairie City, Burnt Prairie and Phillipstown. This includes Interstate 64 in Illinois between Mile Markers 100 and 130. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
